answers.answer: You need to have some tests done. This could be a problem with your blood circulation so you need to have your heart and circulation examined . You should have your blood checked for things like Diabetes. You also need to have your SED rate and other tests done to look for an autoimmune disorder of some type. It is most likely, you are having a problem with one of these things.

question: Many years ago my left foot and ankle started swelling, now both of them swell all the time. I can put on my tennis shoes and in couple of hours it will go away. I take them off and they swell up again. I take water pills but they do not help. What could it be? How can I fix it?
title: Feet and ankles swelling
